name: Thomas Edison
description: Thomas Edison helped establish cinema as an art-form and mass entertainment. Many of his early films were short and showed everyday activities like riding a bicycle.

key_work.title: Thomas Alva Edison
key_work.brief_description: After seeing Eadweard Muybridge’s and Étienne-Jules Marey’s photography, Thomas Edison charged Scottish inventor William Dickson with developing the Kinetoscope, a large cabinet housing 50-foot loops of film that showed short movies on everything from dancing women to boxing cats.

links.description: Directed by Thomas Edison, Bicycle Trick Riding No.2 (1899) lasts for just under a minute and features cycling stuntman Neidert performing tricks. It’s one of the earliest examples of the moving image. Edison would later go on to be played by Benedict Cumberbatch in The Current War.

start.title: True Blood
start.creator_credit: Alexander Woo, Brian Buckner, Nancy Oliver, Raelle Tucker, W. Mark McNair, HBO, Your Face Goes Here Entertainment and Chris Offutt
start.brief_description: True Blood is an American television drama series created and produced by Alan Ball. It is based on The Southern Vampire Mysteries series of novels by Charlaine Harris, detailing the co-existence of vampires and humans in Bon Temps, a fictional, small town in northwestern Louisiana. The series centers on the adventures of Sookie Stackhouse, a telepathic waitress with an otherworldly quality.

links.description: True Blood was considered the start of ‘peak TV’ thanks to its ability to examine issues of race and sexuality through a genre lens. Directing and writing several episodes was groundbreaking filmmaker Angela Robinson, who got her start with the action-packed comedic short D.E.B.S.

end.title: But I'm a Cheerleader
end.creator_credit: Andrea Sperling, Leanna Creel, Lionsgate and The Kushner-Locke Company
end.brief_description: Megan is an all-American girl. A cheerleader. She has a boyfriend. But Megan doesn’t like kissing her boyfriend very much. And she’s pretty touchy with her cheerleader friends. Her conservative parents worry that she must be a lesbian and send her off to “sexual redirection” school, where she must, with other lesbians and gays learn how to be straight.

constellations_other.name: Retro aesthetics and feminine experiences
constellations_other.description: Discover how design and aesthetics from 1950s and 1960s have been utilized in female stories on screen, revealing how screen makers draw on the perceived optimism and social realities of the period to highlight women’s experiences.

end.title: Strays
end.creator_credit: George Zakk, Zeljka Pavlinovic and Vin Diesel
end.brief_description: Rick (Diesel) is frustrated by the repetitious grind of one-night stands and aimless hustling. Whilst looking for more to his life he meets Heather (Lanza), a neighbour. Rick takes the opportunity to escape his boring life style with her, but soon finds that his volatile behaviour threatens to finish their relationship before it even really begins.

links.description: The Town That Dreaded Sundown was a remake of the 1976 slasher of the same name, based on the true story of the Texarkana Moonlight Murders.
